summary: The implementation provides a functional ocean conservation donation website with React/TypeScript frontend and Motoko backend. Most requirements are implemented, but there are a few critical gaps: REQ-4 acceptance criteria for timestamps and data persistence are not evident in the code, and the generated images are missing from the repository. The ocean-themed design is well-executed with proper color palettes and styling.

missing_requirements.requirement: Store donation records with amount and timestamp
missing_requirements.reason: The Donation type in backend/main.mo does not include a timestamp field. Only donorName, amount, and message are stored.
The backend uses a mutable List without stable storage declarations. The donations variable is not marked as stable, which means data will be lost on canister upgrades.

missing_requirements.requirement: Generated images are stored in frontend/public/assets/generated directory
missing_requirements.reason: The diff shows no generated image files being added. Images are referenced in code (hero-ocean.dim_1920x600.png, sea-turtle.dim_800x600.png, coral-reef.dim_800x600.png, dolphins.dim_800x600.png, whale.dim_800x600.png, conservation-icon.dim_256x256.png) but the actual image files are not present in the added files list.

hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest explicitly lists 'User authentication system' as a non-goal, yet the implementation includes full Internet Identity provider setup with useInternetIdentity hook, AuthClient integration, login/logout functionality, and identity management.
